thread.title: Woman dies after getting stuck in clothing drop box
thread.title_full: Woman dies after getting stuck in clothing drop box

title: Woman dies after getting stuck in clothing drop box
text:
Woman dies after getting stuck in clothing drop box Last updated 19:07, February 8 2017 Facebook 
Judith Permar was found with her feet suspended above the ground. 
A woman in the United States has died after getting her arm caught in a clothing donation drop-off box in Pennsylvania. 
Northumberland County Coroner James Kelley says 56-year-old Judith Permar died from a combination of trauma injuries she sustained in the accident and hypothermia. 
The coroner says the Mount Carmel woman used a step stool to reach into the bin, and her left arm became stuck when the stool collapsed. She broke her left arm and wrist and couldn't get free. Fairfax 
Judith Permar broke her left arm and wrist and couldn't get free from the bin, similar to the one pictured here. 
Investigators believe she went to the drop box at about 2am Sunday. 
She was found dead more than six hours later with her feet suspended above the ground, investigators said. 
"She was fishing bags out and the ladder she was standing on gave way and she couldn't get her hand loose," said Mount Carmel Police Chief Brian Hollenbush. 
Hollenbush, who knew Permar, described her as a very nice woman. 
"It wasn't something that I would expect to be seeing," he said. 
Bags with clothes and shoes that had been pulled from the bin were on the ground. Permar's black Hummer was nearby with the engine still running, Hollenbush said. 
Permar leaves behind her husband, three sons, one daughter and four grandchildren.
